commits.message: Hack around volume permissions issue, probably

issue.title: Mounted docker volume /var/jenkins_home/jobs has wrong permissions
issue.body:
## Problem

I want to bake Jenkins configuration with [CasC](https://wiki.jenkins.io/display/JENKINS/Configuration+as+Code+Plugin) into a Docker image, but preserve job results when rebuilding/redeploying the container.

### Docker commands that you execute / Actual result

1. If I use a Docker volume for the entire `jenkins_home` directory, as:

   ```
   docker run -v jenkins_home:/var/jenkins_home -P -d myImage
   ```

   then the first CasC YAML file I `COPY` into my Docker image is preserved, and
   subsequent updates in rebuilt Docker images are ignored.

2. If I try using a Docker volume just for the `jobs` directory, as:

   ```
   docker run -v jenkins_home_jobs:/var/jenkins_home/jobs -P -d myImage
   ```

   something bad happens to the Jenkins home directory structure and I get

   ```
   Mar 25, 2019 11:32:59 PM hudson.util.BootFailure publish
   SEVERE: Failed to initialize Jenkins
   hudson.util.HudsonFailedToLoad: org.jvnet.hudson.reactor.ReactorException: java.io.IOException: 
   jenkins.model.InvalidBuildsDir: ${ITEM_ROOTDIR}/builds does not exist and probably cannot be 
   created
        at hudson.WebAppMain$3.run(WebAppMain.java:250)
   ```

### Expected outcome

- CasC `jenkins.yaml` can be baked into Dockerfile
- job logs, artifacts, etc. are preserved when rebuilding / re-running a container

### Have you tried a non-dockerized Jenkins and get the expected outcome?

- N/A

### Output of `docker version`

```
Client: Docker Engine - Community
 Version:           18.09.2
 API version:       1.39
 Go version:        go1.10.8
 Git commit:        6247962
 Built:             Sun Feb 10 04:12:39 2019
 OS/Arch:           darwin/amd64
 Experimental:      false

Server: Docker Engine - Community
 Engine:
  Version:          18.09.2
  API version:      1.39 (minimum version 1.12)
  Go version:       go1.10.6
  Git commit:       6247962
  Built:            Sun Feb 10 04:13:06 2019
  OS/Arch:          linux/amd64
  Experimental:     true
```

### Other relevant information

Full project at https://github.com/dmolesUC3/mrt-jenkins-docker

comment.body:
Workaround: install `sudo`, run as `root`, and override the `ENTRYPOINT` to run the following script, which (1) `chowns` the directory at run time and (2) uses `sudo` to run `jenkins.sh` as `jenkins`.

```
#!/bin/bash -e

chown -R jenkins:jenkins ${JENKINS_HOME} && \
  sudo --login -u jenkins \
    JENKINS_HOME=${JENKINS_HOME} \
    JENKINS_WAR=${JENKINS_WAR} \
    COPY_REFERENCE_FILE_LOG=${COPY_REFERENCE_FILE_LOG} \
    JAVA_OPTS=${JAVA_OPTS} \
    JENKINS_SLAVE_AGENT_PORT=${JENKINS_SLAVE_AGENT_PORT} \
    JENKINS_OPTS=${JENKINS_OPTS} \
    DEBUG=${DEBUG} \
    /usr/local/bin/jenkins.sh "$@"
```

Dockerfile additions, for completeness:

```
USER root
RUN apt-get install -y sudo
COPY scripts/fix-perms-and-start-jenkins.sh /usr/local/bin/
ENTRYPOINT ["/sbin/tini", "-vvv", "--", "/usr/local/bin/fix-perms-and-start-jenkins.sh"]
```

issue.title: Mounted docker volume /var/jenkins_home/jobs has wrong permissions
issue.body:
## Problem

I want to bake Jenkins configuration with [CasC](https://wiki.jenkins.io/display/JENKINS/Configuration+as+Code+Plugin) into a Docker image, but preserve job results when rebuilding/redeploying the container.

### Docker commands that you execute / Actual result

1. If I use a Docker volume for the entire `jenkins_home` directory, as:

   ```
   docker run -v jenkins_home:/var/jenkins_home -P -d myImage
   ```

   then the first CasC YAML file I `COPY` into my Docker image is preserved, and
   subsequent updates in rebuilt Docker images are ignored.

2. If I try using a Docker volume just for the `jobs` directory, as:

   ```
   docker run -v jenkins_home_jobs:/var/jenkins_home/jobs -P -d myImage
   ```

   something bad happens to the Jenkins home directory structure and I get

   ```
   Mar 25, 2019 11:32:59 PM hudson.util.BootFailure publish
   SEVERE: Failed to initialize Jenkins
   hudson.util.HudsonFailedToLoad: org.jvnet.hudson.reactor.ReactorException: java.io.IOException: 
   jenkins.model.InvalidBuildsDir: ${ITEM_ROOTDIR}/builds does not exist and probably cannot be 
   created
        at hudson.WebAppMain$3.run(WebAppMain.java:250)
   ```

### Expected outcome

- CasC `jenkins.yaml` can be baked into Dockerfile
- job logs, artifacts, etc. are preserved when rebuilding / re-running a container

### Have you tried a non-dockerized Jenkins and get the expected outcome?

- N/A

### Output of `docker version`

```
Client: Docker Engine - Community
 Version:           18.09.2
 API version:       1.39
 Go version:        go1.10.8
 Git commit:        6247962
 Built:             Sun Feb 10 04:12:39 2019
 OS/Arch:           darwin/amd64
 Experimental:      false

Server: Docker Engine - Community
 Engine:
  Version:          18.09.2
  API version:      1.39 (minimum version 1.12)
  Go version:       go1.10.6
  Git commit:       6247962
  Built:            Sun Feb 10 04:13:06 2019
  OS/Arch:          linux/amd64
  Experimental:     true
```

### Other relevant information

Full project at https://github.com/dmolesUC3/mrt-jenkins-docker

comment.body:
After further investigation, it looks ass through the problem is that the mounted `/var/jenkins_home/jobs` is not writable by `jenkins`. In fact, nothing in `/var/jenkins_home` is:

```
jenkins@e1e903afe125:/$ ls -l /var/jenkins_home/
total 16
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 1605 Mar 25 23:23 jenkins.yaml
drwxr-xr-x 2 root root 4096 Mar 27 22:58 jobs
-rw-rw-r-- 1 root root 7152 Feb 14 08:55 tini_pub.gpg
```

I tried adding an explicit `RUN chown` command to the Dockerfile:

```
USER root
RUN chown -R jenkins:jenkins /var/jenkins_home

# make sure we still run jenkins as jenkins
USER jenkins
```

but this had no effect, even after blowing away the Docker volume and starting a fresh container.

As a workaround, I was able to start a container with an interactive root shell, `chown` the directory again, `commit` that, and then run the committed version with an explicit endpoint:

```
$ docker run -v jenkins_home_jobs:/var/jenkins_home/jobs -P -it -u root --entrypoint /bin/bash mrt-jenkins-docker 
root@3aa74d03ad9a:/# chown -R jenkins:jenkins /var/jenkins_home
root@3aa74d03ad9a:/# exit
exit
cdl-dmoles-9m:mrt-jenkins-docker david$ docker commit 3aa7 permfix
sha256:4054d5b0c67699678bd889a802d78364c4d4bc09ca7dacadc19473f16c36b969
cdl-dmoles-9m:mrt-jenkins-docker david$ docker run -v jenkins_home_jobs:/var/jenkins_home/jobs -P -d --entrypoint /sbin/tini permfix -- /usr/local/bin/jenkins.sh
552f04dbe4fe7b4152d51bad5db0ea7ee2c84cfc3cd9a88c2550cc6b3cb00367
```

I can probably script all that, but it seems as though there should be a better way.

commits.message: Reorder Dockerfile to group related operations
Try mounting just jobs directory as a volume

payload.description: A sandbox Docker image for Merritt continous delivery development

issue.title: Preserve job output (only) as Docker volume

commits.message: Use a docker volume for /var/jenkins_home so we don't lose job history when we blow away the container
Check for 'Jenkins is fully up and running' log message instead of existence of logs directory
Upgrade Rails to get latest security fixes

Merge pull request #33 from CDLUC3/lostorage

1. Fix LostorageController redirect logic
2. Update gems to get security fixes

issue.title: Error installing 1.3.13+ on macOS 10.14
issue.body:
Versions 1.4.0 and 1.3.13 both fail with `Makefile:88: *** missing separator.  Stop.`

```
$ gem install sqlite3 -v '1.3.13' --source 'http://rubygems.org/'
Building native extensions.  This could take a while...
ERROR:  Error installing sqlite3:
        ERROR: Failed to build gem native extension.

    current directory: /Users/david/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.4.4/gems/sqlite3-1.3.13/ext/sqlite3
/Users/david/.rvm/rubies/ruby-2.4.4/bin/ruby -r ./siteconf20190321-13475-1s6r07k.rb extconf.rb
checking for sqlite3.h... yes
checking for pthread_create() in -lpthread... yes
checking for sqlite3_libversion_number() in -lsqlite3... yes
checking for rb_proc_arity()... yes
checking for rb_integer_pack()... yes
checking for sqlite3_initialize()... yes
checking for sqlite3_backup_init()... yes
checking for sqlite3_column_database_name()... yes
checking for sqlite3_enable_load_extension()... no
checking for sqlite3_load_extension()... no
checking for sqlite3_open_v2()... yes
checking for sqlite3_prepare_v2()... yes
checking for sqlite3_int64 in sqlite3.h... yes
checking for sqlite3_uint64 in sqlite3.h... yes
creating Makefile

current directory: /Users/david/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.4.4/gems/sqlite3-1.3.13/ext/sqlite3
make "DESTDIR=" clean
Makefile:88: *** missing separator.  Stop.

current directory: /Users/david/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.4.4/gems/sqlite3-1.3.13/ext/sqlite3
make "DESTDIR="
Makefile:88: *** missing separator.  Stop.

make failed, exit code 2
```
